newsitem.title: FINLAND: UPM down three pct after Finland-ERM link.
newsitem.headline: UPM down three pct after Finland-ERM link.

text.p: Finland's biggest forestry UPM-Kymmene Oy fell sharply in cautious Monday morning trade as some investors saw the markka's weekend link to the ERM hitting Finnish forest industry's competitiveness, brokers said.
In its first trade, the stock fell 3.00 markka or 3.2 percent to 91.50 but with only 2,000 shares traded.
Bids for the stock were slightly higher and it later traded at 93.00, off 1.50 markka or 1.59 percent but volumes were almost piecemeal and the market hesitant.
At 1100/0800 GMT, the forest industry sub-index was down 1.6 percent, off its earlier lows, as Enso also edged back from early weakness.

"Many players had decided to sell forestries if Finland joins the ERM and Sweden stays out," one broker said; but added that weakness was likely to be a temporary knee-jerk reaction with bargain-hunters set to sniff out opportunities.
Metsa-Serla B share traded at 28.00 markka, down 0.60 markka or more than two percent, and Enso R share was at 34.30 markka, down 0.80 markka or just over two percent, also in thin trade.
